feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 02 at 1:42PM AKDT until April 03 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT SUNDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. Plan on areas of poor visibilities and difficult travel conditions at times. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast especially near Point Lay.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 3:24PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Breezy Sunday With Stronger Winds Monday... A series of disturbances will bring increased breezes Sunday afternoon and evening, with stronger winds Monday afternoon and evening. For Sunday, westerly gusts of 20 to 30 mph with around 35 mph in wind prone locations, is expected. For Monday, there is potential for westerly gusts of 35 to 45 mph, with gusts 45 to 60
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 4:01PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy frost possible in Sheltered Valleys early Sunday Morning... Widespread low temperatures of 34 to 39 are expected early Sunday morning. A few 33 degree readings are possible in the coldest hollows. This will be cold enough for patchy light frost in the typically coldest locations. If you have frost-sensitive vegetation, consider providing protection to avoid possible
entry.cap:areaDesc: Clay; Jackson; Knox; Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Rockcastle; Whitley

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued April 02 at 2:30PM PDT until April 05 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...LATE SEASON WINTER STORM TO DELIVER HEAVY SNOW TO THE CASCADE CREST... .Snow will increase Sunday evening and become heavy at times into Monday. Snow over the Cascade crest will continue to accumulate through Monday night into Tuesday morning. Winter travel conditions will be likely along Highway 2 from Coles Corner to Stevens Pass.

entry.summary: ...THREAT OF RIVER FLOODING MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING FOR KING COUNTY... A couple of frontal systems will bring rain, heavy at times, Sunday afternoon through Monday night.
